Package imagingbook.spectral.dct

Class Dct2dFast

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.spectral.dct.Dct2dFast
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dct2d
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Dct2dFast.Double, Dct2dFast.Float
    public class Dct2dFast
extends Object

    Fast implementation of the 2-dimensional DCT. Note that this class has no public constructor - instantiate sub-class Dct2dFast.Float or Dct2dFast.Double instead, as shown below. See Ch. 20 of [1] for additional details.

    Usage example (for float data): 

     float[][] data = {{1, 2, 3}, {4, 5, 6}, {7, 8, 9}, {-2, -1, 0}};
 int w = data.length;       // w = 4
 int h = data[0].length;    // h = 3
 Dct2d.Float dct = new Dct2dFast.Float(w, h);
 dct.forward(data);  // data now is the 2D DCT spectrum
 dct.inverse(data);  // data now is the original 2D signal 
 ...

    [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).

    See Also:
    Dct1dFast

      Two-dimensional DCT implementation using double data.

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getHeight()
      Returns the 'height' of the 2D data array (length of dimension 1).
      int getWidth()
      Returns the 'width' of the 2D data array (length of dimension 0).

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Description copied from interface: Dct2d
        Returns the 'width' of the 2D data array (length of dimension 0). Data arrays are indexed as data[x][y], with 0 ≤ x < width and 0 ≤ y < height.
        Specified by:
        getWidth in interface Dct2d
        Returns:
        the width of the 2D data array

        Specified by:
